boardgame.name: Merkator
boardgame.description: Merkator is about the rise of Hamburg after the Thirty Years' War._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;You visit cities to collect goods or fulfill orders. The collected goods are added to the cities when a player visits a neighboring city. Fulfilling an order provides you with another better, but more complex order additional to the fulfilled order which you keep and can fulfill again, although the number of orders you can own is limited. Each order itself is worth a certain amount of points at the end of the game. Also you can exchange these points for special cards which provide additional goods in certain cities or more victory points if you fulfill certain conditions at game end._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Depending on the city you want to enter you either receive a resource called _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;time_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; or you have to spend it. By paying a certain time-fee you are allowed to accompany another player on his trip to a town to fulfill your orders in this town (but not to collect goods). The game ends when a player receives the order with the highest value by fulfilling the order one level below._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Very good condition. Box shows just a small amount of shelf wear and a few very small marks. Components are in excellent condition, and show little to no wear. (I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll add that the cubes (there are more than 300) in this one aren_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t the most consistently produced components I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ve seen in a board game. There are some very slight color variations (e.g., some red cubes are just a little darker than others), and a few cubes aren_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t quite cubical. I don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t think either of these issues rise to the level of a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;defect,_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; but since I did notice, I thought I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;d mention it for those who might care.) Shipping cost will be my actual cost to ship from 95008. (Feel free to geekmail for a quote). Local pickup in San Jose, CA, is available as well. Thanks for looking!
